name: researcher_analyst
description: Research and analyze information from web, docs, and memory. Use when user needs: data collection, fact verification, literature review, competitive analysis. Returns: structured findings with citations.

task.description: The research question or analysis objective. Be specific about what information is needed (e.g., 'Latest pricing models for LLM APIs') and the context/goal (e.g., 'to calculate cost savings').

sources.description: List of sources to search. 'web' for internet, 'docs' for local documentation, 'memory' for user facts/history, 'code' for repository analysis. Defaults to all if not specified.

depth.description: Research rigor level. 'quick_scan' (~5 min) for surface facts. 'deep_dive' (~15 min) for detailed analysis. 'comprehensive' (~30 min) for exhaustive coverage.

output_format.description: Desired structure of the findings. 'summary' for a brief overview, 'detailed_report' for in-depth sections, 'bullet_points' for quick readability. Default: summary.
